alert.note: Alert for Butler; Ripley; Stoddard; Wayne (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 4:52AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Ripley, southeastern Wayne, western Stoddard and Butler Counties through 530 AM CDT... At 451 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Puxico to near Poplar Bluff to near Budapest to near Gatewood. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Poplar Bluff and Gatewood around 455 AM CDT. Fisk and Fairdealing around 500 AM CDT. Oxly around 510 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Naylor, Neelyville, Qulin, Dexter, Dudley and Bernie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
